intro: Astragalus sarchanensis, commonly known as the Sarchan milkvetch, is a perennial legume native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellowish to brownish flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and is adapted to survive in dry, sandy environments. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its seed pods are typically hairy and contain several small, rounded seeds.
